dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so we've all been there, right? Staring down a negotiation, feeling, uh, a little unprepared.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so we've all been there, right? Staring down a negotiation, feeling, uh, a little unprepared.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely! And, like, the article really drives home how much of that success, or lack thereof, really boils down to the prep.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely! And, like, the article really drives home how much of that success, or lack thereof, really boils down to the prep.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Effectively identifying your goals and objectives is seemingly a simple step but many experts suggest it accounts for 50% of your success.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it says 50% of your success is just identifying your goals and objectives. Which, you know, sounds simple but, uh, it's not just about the money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it says fifty percent of your success is just identifying your goals and objectives. Which, you know, sounds simple but, uh, it's not just about the money.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Effectively identifying your goals and objectives is seemingly a simple step but many experts suggest it accounts for 50% of your success. The important part of this step setting goals and objectives has to take into consideration not only direct gains, profits and benefits.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Right, exactly! It's not just the direct gains. It's about your business environment, like, the people around you, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, exactly! It's not just the direct gains. It's about your business environment, like, the people around you, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These are imperative, but equally vital are your business and life environment as well as the cultural perceptions and expectations of the people around you.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Mmm-hmm. And thinking short-term *and* long-term. Is this, uh, a one-time thing or a collaboration that'll grow?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mmm-hmm. And thinking short-term and long-term. Is this, uh, a one-time thing or a collaboration that'll grow?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Therefore after writing your goals (at least four), you should assess them both from the short- and long-term perspective and a level of pressure you are ready to use on the negotiation table by asking a question about the forthcoming negotiations: Is this a one-time engagement or the beginning of the long road of a collaboration process, which will grow in value over time?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And speaking of prep, information, like, it's *power*. You gotta fuel that success, right? The 5W1H formula? Classic for a reason.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And speaking of prep, information, like, it's power. You gotta fuel that success, right? The five W one hours formula? Classic for a reason.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Information is power! Small or big negotiations, it doesnt matter information is the fuel of your success in moving towards your goals and objectives. Thus, it is important to prepare well by collecting and analyzing information using a classic MBA formula for business background research and problem solving: 5W or 5W1H (who, what, when, where, why and how).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. And, um, with all the tech we have now, it's easier than ever to gather that intel. Think LinkedIn, databanks...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. And, um, with all the tech we have now, it's easier than ever to gather that intel. Think LinkedIn, databanks...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Modern Information and Communication Technologies (ICTs) provide great tools for information gathering including general business data in databanks and information about counterparts on LinkedIn, Facebook, etc.).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no excuses anymore. And then, uh, the SWOT analysis. So simple, but it's, like, so powerful.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no excuses anymore. And then, uh, the S W O T analysis. So simple, but it's, like, so powerful.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: SWOT analysis is a simple yet very powerful tool in preparation for the negotiation process.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Especially when you do one for yourself, but then also one, like, for the other side of the table. That's, uh, super insightful.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially when you do one for yourself, but then also one, like, for the other side of the table. That's, uh, super insightful.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is especially useful if you run one SWOT assessing your own position, and run the second SWOT for understanding the strengths and weaknesses of the other side of the table.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, really helps you understand where they're coming from. And then, thinking about tactics, the article talks about having a walk-away alternative. That's huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, really helps you understand where they're coming from. And then, thinking about tactics, the article talks about having a walk-away alternative. That's huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Experts even suggest developing an acceptable walk-away alternative in order not to get so desperate that you sign an abysmal deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Huge! I mean, how many times have we heard colleagues say, "Ugh, I forgot to ask that!" or "I should've clarified this."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huge! I mean, how many times have we heard colleagues say, "Ugh, I forgot to ask that!" or "I should've clarified this."
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: How often we do hear avoidable regrets expressed by our colleagues and other negotiators I forgot to ask this question! or I forgot to clarify this issue or option!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: All the time! So, like, those pre-meeting questions? So, so vital. To identify red herrings, even.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: All the time! So, like, those pre-meeting questions? So, so vital. To identify red herrings, even.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Running the pre-meeting questions and scenarios is especially important so you can identify red herrings to offer (issues that have no value for you but might have value for the other side) and build your defense line and your breaking point.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, things that don't matter to you but could really matter to them. And then, uh, obviously, setting a clear agenda is key.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, things that don't matter to you but could really matter to them. And then, uh, obviously, setting a clear agenda is key.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, all textbook examples of successful negotiations suggest that it is crucial to set up a clear and mutually agreed agenda right at the beginning, with a sequence of negotiation steps, and to clarify expected outcomes (e.g., signing a deal).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And, um, even with all this rational planning, the psychology of it all, that confidence and respect, really makes a difference.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And, um, even with all this rational planning, the psychology of it all, that confidence and respect, really makes a difference.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The psychological dimension of negotiation meetings makes a surprisingly big impact on the negotiation process and outcomes... successful negotiation includes... engaging in the bargaining process with full confidence as well as full respect for the person or a team across the table.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's not just about being, like, super logical. It's about how you carry yourself.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's not just about being, like, super logical. It's about how you carry yourself.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The psychological dimension of negotiation meetings makes a surprisingly big impact on the negotiation process and outcomes, even though in the business setting we expect to see extremely rational people with rational approaches.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. So, in the end, it really comes down to having your own style, but also, like, keeping an archive of what works for you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. So, in the end, it really comes down to having your own style, but also, like, keeping an archive of what works for you.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: it is important to establish your own style and approach to the negotiation process by creating your personal archive with a set of notes or databank about every successful negotiation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Mmm, smart. So much of it is just, uh, learning from experience and refining your approach.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mmm, smart. So much of it is just, uh, learning from experience and refining your approach.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. So, next time you're heading into a negotiation, remember these tips!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. So, next time you're heading into a negotiation, remember these tips!
